intro: Mapania ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty mapania, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a rough texture. Mapania ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
